DOC.brief_summary: This is a study to investigate whether instilling a small amount of liquid lidocaine into the uterus will decrease pain felt by women during laminaria insertions done for cervical dilation prior to second trimester abortion. The investigators hypothesize that women who receive intrauterine lidocaine in addition to a paracervical block will experience less pain than women who receive only a paracervical block.
DOC.criteria: Can sign informed consent Healthy pregnant females Weight over 45kg Seeking abortion by dilation and evacuation in the second trimester of pregnancy Gestational age 1424 weeks confirmed by clinic ultrasound Known allergy or previous reaction to lidocaine, bupivicaine or other anesthetic agent Known allergy or previous reaction to ibuprofen or other NSAID
